overview: The improved Pull Request Files Changed experience receives February 5 updates including CODEOWNERS validation, performance improvements up to 67% faster for large PRs, small screen fixes, and multiple bug fixes. The feature remains in preview.

detailed_explanation.title: CODEOWNERS and reviewer improvements
bullets: CODEOWNERS validation has been added to the Files Changed view.
Required reviewers are now correctly surfaced based on CODEOWNERS rules.
These additions improve code review workflow accuracy.

detailed_explanation.title: Small screen and responsive fixes
bullets: Fixes applied for mobile and smaller viewport layouts.
Improved usability on non-desktop screen sizes.

detailed_explanation.title: Performance improvements
bullets: Interactions are up to 67% faster for large pull requests.
Virtualization added for the largest PRs to reduce DOM overhead.
Tab navigation improved from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
File tree resizing is now smoother.

detailed_explanation.title: Bug fixes
bullets: Fixed notification read state not updating correctly.
Fixed code snippet background color rendering.
Fixed commenting across large index diffs.

key_changes: CODEOWNERS validation added with correct surfacing of required reviewers.
Up to 67% faster interactions for large pull requests with virtualization for the largest PRs.
Tab navigation reduced from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
Small screen and mobile viewport fixes.
Bug fixes for notification read state, sticky diff headers, code snippet background color, and commenting across large index diffs.
impact: Teams with CODEOWNERS files will see accurate required reviewer assignments directly in the Files Changed view.
Developers reviewing large PRs will experience significantly faster load times and smoother interactions.
Mobile and small-screen users benefit from improved layout and usability.
Safari users gain improved stability when reviewing diffs.
caveats: The Files Changed experience is still in preview and not yet the default.
Performance numbers (67% faster) are upper-bound figures and may vary depending on PR size and complexity.
Virtualization benefits apply primarily to the largest pull requests.
insights: The 67% performance improvement and virtualization suggest GitHub is addressing long-standing pain points with large PR reviews that have driven users to CLI-based review tools.
Adding CODEOWNERS validation directly in Files Changed reduces context switching between settings and review workflows.
Continued investment in this preview indicates GitHub is building toward replacing the current Files Changed view entirely.
